Job Title: Avionics Technician III- 2nd shift

Location: Miramar, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
2nd Shift Schedule: Monday - Friday, 3:00 pm - 11:30 pm **

SUMMARY: The Avionic Technician I II must demonstrate high mechanical aptitude and will inspect, service, maintain , troubleshoot, repair, and overhaul aircraft components while maintaining a safe work environment and following all company and federal rules/ regulations.

Duties & Responsibilities

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

 Troubleshoot, repair, inspect, modify and service aircraft avionics /accessories/oxygen equipment .  Perform and document work performed per appropriate manuals and regulations as required  Adhere to Bombardier General Work Requirements for factory, shop and/or hangar positions  Comply with environmental health and safety policies and procedures  Participate in 5-S activities  Perform all assigned tasks in a safe and timely manner  Operate ground support equipment as required  Assist with mechanical / electrical removals and installations  Assist with maintenance at off-site locations as needed  Assist with other maintenance disciplines as needed  Other duties as assigned. 

Requirements

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS (INCLUDES EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, COMPETENCIES), ETC.) :

 Bachelor’s degree  5 + year of relevant/technical work experience OR  An additional 3 years of specific work experience in lieu of degree .  The ability to teardown, inspection, parts requisition, assembly, testing, troubleshooting, repair, and overhaul of aircraft accessory /avionic/oxygen units to the component level.  Ability to read and understand electrical engineering drawings  Ability to effectively communicate in both written and verbal form on individual and / or aircraft status  Must be computer literate, and proficient with Microsoft Office programs (Outlook, Word, and Excel). 

Preferred Requirements

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS (INCLUDES PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, COMPETENCIES), ETC.) :

 Master’s degree  8 + years of specific work experience  Strong knowledge of avionic components  Strong knowledge of accessory components  Strong knowledge of oxygen components  Digital selector panels  FCC General Radio Telephone license 

OTHER (INCLUDE LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, SECURITY CLEARANCE, TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS, ETC.) :

 The selected applicant will be subject to a background check and drug testing. 

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer . VSE considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

VSE is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
